sub_title: 8 years with non profit  organisations, marketing expertise, and brand development. With a creative edge seeking new opportunities to drive growth and achieve success"
summary:
I have spent the past 10 years working in various roles in the music and entertainment industry, including as a content creator, brand ambassador, and social media curator . My experience working with a variety of artists and brands, such as D.O. Gibson, Atwell Music, Hip Hop Saves Lives, Subliminal Worldwide, Stroopwafel, Mill Green, JJ From Yonkers, Gambit Gasolina, Loud Life, and more, has provided me with a deep understanding of what it takes to create and market of successful campaigns and brands from the start up. Notably, I had the opportunity to work with Hip Hop Saves Lives, a well-known nonprofit organization that teaches humanity through hip hop. During my time there, I worked on creating content, social media marketing, tour management, video editing, branding, graphic, and other marketing initiatives to spread the organization's message to a global audience.

I have also been involved in the startup world, founding The Dutch New Yorker Barber Scholarship Program in Uganda Kampala and opening The Dutch New Yorker Barber Shop in Amsterdam. The success of both ventures has given me a wealth of knowledge in growth and marketing strategies for startups.

In my current role as a concept creator and content creator for Subliminal Worldwide, I have successfully launched the monthly Stroopwafel event which is a LGBTQ+ friendly, community driven, open minded event filled with different creatives doing live performances throughout the event and techno music in Amsterdam. The goal is to bring everyone from the community under one roof without judgment and without phones. Upon entry a sticker is placed on the consumers phone cameras to keep them present. So they can enjoy eye opening performances, visuals, and music. Subliminal Worldwide has become a staple in the local music scene. 
Additionally, I have helped Subliminal build a strong brand identity and increase its reach through social media.

My experience in navigating multiple industries, combined with my passion for music, AI, and startups, makes me confident that I am the right person for this position. I am excited about the opportunity to join your team and contribute to the growth and success of your startup.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to further discuss my qualifications with you.

education.field_of_study: Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Support Services

projects.title: I Ain't Going Back Tour For Social Change
projects.description:
The Dutch New Yorker Barber Shop is a stylish barber shop located in the heart of Amsterdam, Netherlands, and owned by Jacob Siegel, a native New Yorker with over a decade of experience in the barbering industry. With a passion for delivering the best possible grooming experience, Jacob has built the shop from the ground up, turning it into a top-rated business that is highly regarded by its clientele.

As a project manager, Jacob has worked tirelessly to create a unique brand that blends the classic New York-style barbering with the latest trends in men's grooming. He has also invested in the latest equipment and products to ensure that his team of skilled barbers can deliver the highest quality services to their customers.

Aside from his success in Amsterdam, Jacob has also made a significant impact in Kampala, Uganda, by founding the Dutch New Yorker Barber Scholarship Program. The program is designed to help young adults in Kampala learn the skills of barbering, giving them the opportunity to build a lifelong career in the industry. Jacob's dedication to this program has seen him provide funding for the purchase of equipment and tools, as well as sending the young adults to barber school to receive professional training.

In summary, The Dutch New Yorker Barber Shop is a top-rated barber shop that delivers exceptional grooming services in the heart of Amsterdam. With a passionate owner who has dedicated his time and resources to improving the lives of others, customers can be assured of an unforgettable grooming experience that leaves them feeling and looking their best.

contributors.headline: 8 years with non profit  organisations, marketing expertise, and brand development. With a creative edge seeking new opportunities to drive growth and achieve success"

profile_positions.description: Jacob Siegel is the founder and owner of Subliminal Worldwide, a creative marketing agency, and the successful Stroopwafel event, a monthly rave for the community held in Amsterdam. With years of experience as a concept and brand creator, Jacob is a skilled creative content creator who has successfully marketed and branded Subliminal and the Stroopwafel event into successful businesses. His expertise in event marketing, graphic design, and social media has helped him sell out club venues and increase brand recognition.
profile_positions.title: Chief Executive Officer

volunteer_experiences.description: I had the opportunity to work with Hip Hop Saves Lives, a well-known nonprofit organization that teaches humanity through hip hop. During my time there, I worked on creating content, social media marketing, tour management, video editing, branding, graphic, and other marketing initiatives to spread the organization's message to a global audience. I have also been involved in the startup world, founding The Dutch New Yorker Barber Scholarship Program in Uganda Kampala and opening The Dutch New Yorker Barber Shop in Amsterdam. The success of both ventures has given me a wealth of knowledge in growth and marketing strategies for startups.

During my time at Hip Hop Saves Lives, I had the privilege of working alongside incredible artists and educators who use hip hop as a tool to inspire and empower young people. As a content creator and social media manager, I helped develop campaigns and strategies to promote events, engage with our audience, and expand our reach. I also produced and edited videos highlighting the impact of our work and showcasing the talents of the youth we serve.

One of my proudest accomplishments at Hip Hop Saves Lives was helping to organize a successful fundraising event that raised over $10,000 to support our programs. Seeing the direct impact of our work on the lives of young people, particularly those from underserved communities, was a deeply rewarding experience that continues to inspire me to this day.
